Good game and story - In regards to the others reviews, I have nothing to add.

This game is a masterpiece. I've never spent so much time playing a single player game ever. The story is amazing, the quests are diverse and exciting and there's so much stuff to do even if you finish the main story without getting the feeling of grinding or anything like that. The story is so catchy that I'll go ahead play the first two games as well and I can barely wait for the sequel/stories of the Witcher universe to come. I highly recommend playing the expansions as well if you finish this, they're really great too.

Out of the few RPG's I have played, this one seems somehow both bloated and dense with absurd amounts of loot-locations. Most dialogue choices are along the lines of 1."continue the conversation" 2."what's a (insert magical creature here)". Combat can be fun even though most fights went the same way, casting Quen and mashing the X button. Oh, I had to connect a controller once I finished the tutorial. After 50 hours I changed the difficulty to easy just to get to the end as fast as possible. I also turned off the music when it's charm began to wear off. There is an absurd amount of loot and gear to collect and sell only to slightly increase some numbers. This story has so much side content and filler that I would forget the main plot, or stop caring and skip half the dialogue. It was a little funny that petty street thugs think they were tougher than Geralt, A Witcher, A man who has seen, fought, slain, and survived things no human ever has. This game does look picturesque, but I for one believe if I'm enjoying the scenery more than anything else in an RPG then there is something wrong. Navigating this world is just a chore and the terrain usually was working against me. I had chat with someone who is a fan and he implore that I romance Triss, but the path towards that didn't look very romantic exactly. I did "Romance" Yennefer which just abruptly cut from a scene of us in a deadly gas trap to us in the bedroom... and a glitch made the sounds and visuals of her magic powers loop throughout the scene. Not too many annoying bugs that I recall other than the final boss being frozen in place for the first phase of the fight. Oh, I forgot his name due to him being so much of a non-factor in the plot for so long and when it came time to fight the Wild Hunt I just didn't feel intimidated by this devastating force (I changed the difficulty back to normal). The Hearts of Stone was very nice...I'm not sure if that was the name of the one I played but I'm definitely not playing the other DLC anytime soon. this was almost 300 hours I could have spent elsewhere. And Gwent might be the least fun minigame I have played. Most times you have to sacrifice that first round, which means you need to have weak cards in your deck to throw away. Any semblance of strategy can fall apart immediately if you don't draw the cards you need or the opponent decides to just render an entire field of units useless.
Fantastic game with great gameplay and story, especially in the dlcs.

After 5 years of listening to nothing but praises for this game, i finally give this game a try and i was completely confuse. Everything surround the story is a complete mix bag. CDPR seems to have lock themselves in a dungoen with no access to the outside world because this game has a lot of outdated feature even for a 2015 game. And my experience was filled with annoying and sometimes game breaking bugs. The story, the characters and the world is worth the praise but the gameplay just made me wish i could play older games that did what this game did but better.

Top 3 melhores jogos que eu j√° joguei na minha vida, sem d√∫vidas.  Esse jogo √© feito com dedica√ß√£o de ponta a ponta, mas vou explicar uma pouco mais abaixo:

Hist√≥ria: 10/10, ate mesmo miss√µes secundarias tem uma historinhas, mas a principal √© de tirar o f√¥lego, qualquer decis√£o sua pode mudar a historia ent√£o voc√™ tem que pensar bem antes de escolher, todos os personagens tem uma import√¢ncia, personalidade e conseguem nos cativar muito, √© uma historia impactante e emocionante sem duvidas.

Gameplay: 10/10 nunca vi igual em algum rpg, e desafiador sem deixar de ser divertido, o jogo te instiga e te recompensa por explorar, √© muito satisfat√≥rio. Voc√™ realmente tira seu tempo para comprar armaduras e espadas e compara-las com as que voc√™ j√° tem, coloca runas, e √© muito divertido.

Gr√°ficos: 10/10 meu pc n√£o √© muito forte, mas mesmo jogando com quase tudo no minimo o jogo √© lindo de doer, na maioria do tempo nem da pra perceber que est√° no minimo  ent√£o imagina no m√°ximo, esse jogo de 6 anos pra c√° (periodo da an√°lise) n√£o envelheceu nada e quest√£o de gr√°ficos e provavelmente vai envelhecer pouco at√© em 20 anos ou mais.

Personagem principal: 10/10 mesmo sendo um bruxo e n√£o possuindo reais sentimentos, Geralt √© um personagem extremamente marcante e cativante, que rende um excelente desenvolvimento de historia e de outros personagens.

Problemas do jogo: 9.5/10, s√≥ alguns bugs visuais que n√£o me atrapalharam na gameplay e nem na narrativa.

Veredito final: 9.9/10 esse jogo √© fant√°stico em todos n√≠veis, se voc√™ tem um dinheiro guardado e pensa em comprar esse jogo, voc√™ nao vai se arrepender nem um pouco e se nao est√° convencido com a minha an√°lise, olhe as outras que s¬¥vao confirmar o que eu digo, bem, √© isso, Adeus!

For a game that has a huge following i was excited to finally dive in and see what I'd been missing, hoping for something to fill the void between the next elder scrolls or proper fallout but alas nothing here for me.
With that said the game is beautiful and Im sure if I persisted with it I'd end up looking past the badly formed combat system, boring crafting and character progression. Its the first open world RPG where I didnt care/was not thinking about picking up everything and selling or using it in some way. I leave a positive review because i reckon if i wasnt pining after an elder scrolls i wouldnt be comparing it to that in everyway. For me i felt like i was playing a badly hashed console port with everything being dumbed down and simplified.

The Witcher 3, el juego perfecto del que todo el mundo habla como referente de los RPGs, no es tan perfecto ni tan referente. A√∫n as√≠ es un buen juego, pero para nada es para endiosarlo como hace la mayor√≠a de gente.

Su nivel t√©cnico es muy alto, con gr√°ficos y ubicaciones muy trabajados est√©ticamente, con una optimizaci√≥n muy buena y llena de detalles.

Como historia no hay nada que reprocharle, tanto la principal como las secundarias son oro, con personajes carism√°ticos y cambios de guion buenos. Algunas con una profundidad remarcable que te posicionaran sobre un bando u otro seg√∫n tus principios morales. Se nota que hay literatura detr√°s de cada palabra. Lo que me parece horrible es que un juego donde la historia es tan protagonista no est√© doblado al castellano, y aunque tenga subt√≠tulos en nuestro idioma, te pierdes un mont√≥n de acciones de las cinem√°ticas por leerlos, para eso que pongan un fondo oscuro y los textos encima y ser√≠a lo mismo porque la mayor√≠a de veces no he llegado a ver ni una expresi√≥n facial‚Ä¶

Hablando de su mundo abierto: s√≠, es enorme, pero tambi√©n me ha dado una sensaci√≥n de vac√≠o y poco inmersivo, me explicar√©. Si bien cada vez que llegas a un pueblo o ciudad parece que vas a notar una sensaci√≥n nueva, parece un corta y pega de POIs y NPCs, donde el tabl√≥n de anuncios es el centro y la herrer√≠a y cantina completan todo lo interesante para la aventura. Incluso en las grandes ciudades se tiene esa sensaci√≥n de estar solo porque los NPCs y las viviendas son atrezo en cantidades descomunales. 

En el tema de aventura tampoco me he sentido muy inmerso (a excepci√≥n de las misiones de contrato) porque puedes irte a explorar el mapa y encontrar ubicaciones muy planas, sin ning√∫n atisbo de picarte el gusanillo aventurero al encontrar una cueva o naufragio, es lo que son: cuevas lineales nada laber√≠nticas ni profundas sin tesoros o trampas especiales y naufragios yermos en interacci√≥n. Una l√°stima porque teniendo ubicaciones tan majestuosas podr√≠an haber hecho grandes cosas. Adem√°s, la m√∫sica que te acompa√±a durante el viaje es siempre la misma, muy pocos temas para un juego tan grande, te cansas de ir encima de Sardinilla cabalgando durante kil√≥metros escuchando una y otra vez el mismo tema. En mi opini√≥n los temas no son tan √©picos como los de otros juegos del mismo g√©nero.

En lo referente al combate he de decir que es muy simple y ortop√©dico. Tanto los movimientos de Geralt como los patrones de ataque e IA de los enemigos son muy b√°sicos y repetitivos, y los niveles de dificultad solo cambian el da√±o recibido, nada de IA mejorada seg√∫n la dificultad.
Sobre el √°rbol de mejoras del personaje es sencillo, pero cumple su cometido en funci√≥n de como quieras que sea tu estilo de juego. Las habilidades y la gesti√≥n de brebajes y pociones mejoran el combate en cierta manera.

Uno de los puntos fuertes y con el que m√°s me he divertido es el ‚Äúminijuego‚Äù de cartas Gwent. Durante la aventura te vas a ir encontrando con oponentes que te ir√°n retando con barajas cada vez m√°s duras y con recompensas de cartas especiales que mejorar√°n tus manos. Lo malo es que sacaron el juego oficial aparte y perdi√≥ la esencia de √©ste.

Una cosa que me ha parecido muy pobre ha sido el tema del loot y robo de objetos de casas, cajas, etc. Resulta que, si quieres saquear cualquier cosa, de lo √∫nico que te tienes que preocupar es de que no haya ning√∫n guardia cerca, si no ni siquiera sus leg√≠timos due√±os te increpar√°n o dar√°n aviso como que eres un ladr√≥n. 

Me dejo unas cuantas cosas, pero para concluir dir√© que no s√© como gente que ha jugado a muchos juegos puede elevarlo a obra maestra cuando es plano en la mayor√≠a de mec√°nicas. Aunque tenga much√≠simo contenido eso no le hace tampoco bueno, porque es lo mismo una y otra vez, para qu√© quiero una casa llena de armarios si todo lo que hay es la misma basura repetida, para eso que pongan un solo armario. Para qu√© quiero mil cuevas o naufragios si todas son iguales sin nada de aventura. El juego es bueno pero no es para tirar cohetes.

Been waiting to play this game for a while, finally got a new laptop to play it on and enjoying it...

I bought the Game of the Year edition and it was one of the best bought game, hell, it is THE Best game that i have ever bought. I heard of the witcher game population, and it is so much more after i played it.

The story was splendidly written, the main quest, side quest and all, never a point where you got lost or bored of the main quest and decide to do other things u could in game, though there are many side quest and discovery in this game but ALL of them are decent. The DLC quest by far is the one that i felt its not a cash grabber: the depth and the plot , characters design and all are decent designed that you wish for even more....

Gameplay is kind of a action RPG, with decent combat system and level up to unlock new skill etc... 

As for soundtrack, " otherworldy amazing " isn't enough to even describe the slightest of it

With the release of Cyberpunk 2077 i notice there were complains regarding to Witcher 3's plot being too long, and yet for some fans, including myself i would say otherwise.

Gameplay      9.5/10
Soundtrack   9.7/10
Graphic           9/10
Story          100/10

Conclusion: It's a must for a gamer, It's an adventure one shalt never miss
